intro: Minuartia grignensis, commonly known as the Grignes rockcress, is a low-growing, mat-forming flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous areas with high altitudes. Its foliage consists of small, linear leaves that are usually covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Minuartia grignensis is a hardy species that is well-adapted to cold climates and is often used in rock gardens or alpine habitats.
